intro: Xylochlamys queenslandica, commonly known as the Queensland chlamydium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal heathlands and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters, with dense, compact growth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
